meanings.definition: A short crowbar used to force things open.
meanings.sent1: He used the jemmies to open the stuck door.
meanings.sent2: The thief carried jemmies in his bag for breaking into houses.
meanings.sent3: The jemmies were like magic keys, unlocking any obstacle in their way.
meanings.sent4: With the jemmies of determination, he pried open the door to success.
meanings.sent5: The shiny jemmies gleamed in the sunlight, ready for any challenge.

meanings.definition: To pry or force open with a crowbar.
meanings.sent1: She carefully jemmied the window open to let in fresh air.
meanings.sent2: The burglars jemmied the lock to gain entry into the house.
meanings.sent3: He jemmies open the stubborn jar lid with a determined twist.
meanings.sent4: The idea jemmied its way into her mind, refusing to be ignored.
meanings.sent5: The detective jemmied the truth out of the suspect with clever questioning.
